_description: The Maid of the Moor — four rondel-type 7-line stanzas (aabbaac)

BodRawD913.First Lines: Maiden in the mor layin the mor lay…
BodRawD913.Last Lines:
…wat was hire bourþe rede rose ante lilie
                    flour
BodRawD913.Note: Item I (b); written as prose, ends imperfectly.

WorcF126.Last Lines: …þe cold water of þe well spryng…
WorcF126.Note:
Introduced by, ‘videlicet karole’; written as
                    prosereference to this song in prose sermon, ‘Viderunt reuolutum
                        lapidem’ — only these lines are given.
